item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Nothing in this world is harder than speaking the truth, nothing easier than flattery." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "If people persist in trespassing upon the grizzlies' territory, we must accept the fact that the grizzlies, from time to time, will harvest a few trespassers." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "How to Overthrow the System: brew your own beer; kick in your Tee Vee; kill your own beef; build your own cabin and piss off the front porch whenever you bloody well feel like it." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "Growth for the sake of growth is the ideology of the cancer cell." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "The rifle and handgun are 'equalizers' -- the weapons of a democracy. Tanks and bombers represent dictatorship." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "An economic system which can only expand or expire must be false to all that is human." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "A man could be a lover and defender of the wilderness without ever in his lifetime leaving the boundaries of asphalt, powerlines, and right-angled surfaces. We need wilderness whether or not we ever set foot in it. We need a refuge even though we may never need to set foot in it. We need the possibility of escape as surely as we need hope; without it the life of the cities would drive all men into crime or drugs or psychoanalysis." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "We are slaves in the sense that we depend for our daily survival upon an expand-or-expire agro-industrial empire—a crackpot machine—that the specialists cannot comprehend and the managers cannot manage. Which is, furthermore, devouring world resources at an exponential rate. We are, most of us, dependent employees. …Edward Abbey (1927-1989) " -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Confucius
item.description: "In a country well governed, poverty is something to be ashamed of. In a country badly governed, wealth is something to be ashamed of." -- Confucius

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Eric Hoffer
item.description: "There is apparently some connection between dissatisfaction with oneself and a proneness to credulity. The urge to escape our real self is also an urge to escape the rational and the obvious. The refusal to see ourselves as we are develops a distaste for facts and cold logic. There is no hope for the frustrated in the actual and the possible. Salvation can come to them only from the miraculous, which seeps through a crack in the iron wall of inexorable reality. They ask to be deceived. What Stresemann said of the Germans is true of the frustrated in general: "They pray not only for their daily bread, but also for their daily illusion." The rule seems to be that those who find no difficulty deceiving themselves are easily deceived by others. They are easily persuaded and led." -- Eric Hoffer

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Jimi Hendrix
item.description: "I'm the one that's got to die when it's time for me to die, so let me live my life the way I want to." -- Jimi Hendrix

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by E. E. Cummings
item.description: "Unbeing dead isn't being alive." -- E. E. Cummings

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by William Morris
item.description: "...I do not want art for a few; any more than education for a few; or freedom for a few... " -- William Morris

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "When did the future switch from being a promise to being a threat?" -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "A man should begin with his own times. He should become acquainted first of all with the world in which he is living and participating. He should not be afraid of reading too much or too little. He should take his reading as he does his food or his exercise. The good reader will gravitate to the good books. He will discover from his contemporaries what is inspiring or fecundating, or merely enjoyable, in past literature. He should have the pleasure of making these discoveries on his own, in his own way. What has worth, charm, beauty, wisdom, cannot be lost or forgotten. But things can lose all value, all charm and appeal, if one is dragged to them by the scalp." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Arnaldur Indridason
item.description: "He knew at once it was a human bone, when he took it from the baby who was sitting on the floor chewing it." -- Arnaldur Indridason

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Gene Wolfe
item.description: "My definition of good literature is that which can be read by an educated reader, and reread with increased pleasure." -- Gene Wolfe

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "I have no faith in human perfectibility. I think that human exertion will have no appreciable effect upon humanity. Man is now only more active - not more happy - nor more wise, than he was 6000 years ago." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "There are some secrets which do not permit themselves to be told." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Experience has shown, and a true philosophy will always show, that a vast, perhaps the larger, portion of truth arises from the seemingly irrelevant." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "How vain it is to sit down to write when you have not stood up to live." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "What lies behind us and what lies ahead of us are tiny matters compared to what lives within us." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Books are the treasured wealth of the world and the fit inheritance of generations and nations." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Read the best books first, or you may not have a chance to read them at all." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Any fool can make a rule And any fool will mind it." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by Barbara Tuchman
item.description:
"Books are the carriers of civilization. Without books, history is silent, literature dumb, science crippled, thought and speculation at a standstill. Without books, the development of civilization would have been impossible. They are engines of change (as the poet said), windows on the world and lighthouses erected in the sea of time. They are companions, teachers, magicians, bankers of the treasures of the mind. Books are humanity in print.
[<i>Bulletin of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences</i>, Vol. 34, No. 2 (Nov. 1980), pp. 16-32]" -- Barbara Tuchman

item.title: Coalbanks add a quote by John Boyle O'Reilly
Coalbanks add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I have never found a companion that was so companionable as solitude." -- Henry David Thoreau
